name: Axial Disc 1 (itch)
description:
Join Oli, Sai, and Amara across Stardust City and choose your favorite Commands in battle against the Agency on your search for purpose in this customizable RPG adventure!

Axial features a unique turn based battle system that revolves heavily on customization and synergy to ensure your team is equipped for any challenge.  With its enthralling story, unique pixel art, Game Boy themed aesthetic, and energetic chiptune soundtrack, Axial is the perfect game for fans of classic JRPGs.

Current Version: 1.0.7

Mature Content:

-Mild Language

-Animated Blood

-Suggestive Themes

Join our Discord Server! - https://discord.gg/cWr8vgd

- - - - FAQ - - - -

Q: How long is the game?

A: On average, the length is about 12 hours from start to finish. There is a great deal of optional content to enjoy, and on harder difficulties the battles can last longer, so this time will obviously vary.

Q: Why is this game free?

A: While I do believe this game has monetary value, money is not my goal. My goal was to simply finish the game (which I've now done), and at this point I just want people to play it and enjoy it, be that for its combat or story. For that reason, I've decided that selling it, even for $1, would detract from a potential audience that could enjoy the game but doesn't have the means to purchase a game online. Aside from that, we began development with no intention of selling it, and I feel it would be unfair to commercialize the game after everyone put in their effort and love without having agreed to how money should be handled up front. After speaking with everyone on the team, however, we are open to optional means of monetization such as selling the soundtrack or accepting donations.

Q: If you aren't making money, why are you so eager for people to play it?

A: Plenty of factors, really. Validation's certainly one. Delusions that this game could attract a fanbase leading to fan-driven works. Wanting to see the efforts of myself and my team actually amount to something would be one as well. But I think really, I'd be happy if this game appealed a great deal to someone. Statistically speaking, there's someone out there who this game will resonate with, and I'm always seeking that person. 


Q: Will there be future installments?

A: It's called "Disc 1" for a reason.

Q: How else can I support this project?

A: Play the game. Tell your friends who like the game to play it. Follow us on Twitter. Give us feedback. Tell us what you like and dislike. At the end of the day, we want to make people happy, and hearing that people enjoyed the game is a great satisfaction. 

Anyway, I hope you enjoy Axial Disc 1!

Feel free to contact us at magnumkid11@gmail.com or @AxialRPG on Twitter!
